    class View.TrafficPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Nested class to manage the traffic elements.
    Author:
    Samuel Scalf
    Date:
    10 OCT 2020
    School:
    University of Maryland Global Campus
    Professor:
    Dr. Osama A. Morad, Ph.D.
    Course:
    CMSC 335 6380 Object-Oriented and Concurrent Programming (2208)

    • Method Detail

      • setCarListener

        public void setCarListener(CarListener c)
        Sets the CarListener responsible for removing car threads.
        Parameters:
        c - the CarListener

      • addLight

        public void addLight(TrafficLight light)
        Adds a TrafficLight to the TrafficLight ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        light - TrafficLight to be added to the GUI.

      • addCar

        public void addCar(Car car)
        Adds a car to the Car ArrayList iff the number of cars is less than the maximum allowed.

        While it is not expected to be encountered, a message will appear to inform the user the maximum number of cars has been reached. This would only happen if the user is somehow able to click "ADD CAR" before it gets disabled.

        Parameters:
        car - The Car to be added to the GUI.

      • removeCar

        private void removeCar(Car car)
        Removes the car from the GUI.

        The Car object is removed from the ArrayList, the number of cars is decreased, and, if the number is less than the maximum, enables the "ADD CAR" button.

        If a carListener has been added, it is informed of the removal.

        Parameters:
        car - The Car that has gone out of the panel.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears the ArrayLists for lights and cars.

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Displays the traffic elements. This first draws the background, checks for collisions, then draws the updated traffic.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The panel's Graphics

      • checkCollisions

        private void checkCollisions()
        Checks the positioning of cars compare to the panel, lights, and other cars. Removes cars that have left the panel.

      • checkLights

        private void checkLights(Car car)
        If a car is at a red light, stops the car until the light changes.
        Parameters:
        car - The car under collision inspection.

      • checkCars

        private void checkCars(Car car)
        If a car is behind another car, stops it from passing through. Cars with higher velocity end up going slower if behind a slower car.
        Parameters:
        car - The car under collision inspection

      • drawTraffic

        private void drawTraffic(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the current state of lights and cars.
        Parameters:
        g - The panel's Graphics

      • getPreferredSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
        Returns the dimensions of the background image, if present. Otherwise, it returns JPanel's defaults.
        Overrides:
        getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Returns:
        the preferred dimensions of the panel

        public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()
        Returns the dimensions of the background image, if present. Otherwise, it returns JPanel's defaults.
        Overrides:
        getMinimumSize in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Returns:
